scSBqgOnk1qlbJ8QO2R_sA.text: I've had crepes (in the states) and I've had crepes.  Somehow they never rocked my world.We had to grab a quick light meal before going to the theatre, so one of us suggested Entre Nous. I said ok I hope it's not another disappointing Creperie.One bite into my spinach and salmon crepe and immediately I remembered that evening outside the steps of the Sacre Coeur at 940pm and still summer bright and being so mesmerized by the crispy and superbly flavored crepe that was whipped up by a local dude in the back of his foodtruck. We shared each other's crepes with greedy delight.I'll come back again before I leave Singapore on this short trip. Entre Nous, my best wishes and congratulations.

2cmueZh_BY8IDdS2y70d7Q.text: I had bookmarked this location to remember to stop by for a weekend brunch or maybe a dessert stop. We came of a Sunday around 12. We thought it would be crowded since it is a small spot. But there were only 2 other groups inside.  They offer sweet and savory crepes. They make their own caramel sauce which they put on their sweet crepes and also sell pots of them. I had a simple ham and cheese crepe. And for dessert i had a chocolate and banana crepe. The chocolate was home made and it came with homemade ice cream. Both of my options were simple and decent. Not sure if they are a bang for your buck, as i feel ive had better crepe options. I could have had a small green salad with the crepe and a bit more filling. My friend ordered the French onion soup, which was nothing special. the cheese wasnt grilled on top  Another friend tried their speciality crepe with the Salted caramel sauce.  it was good and different.  not overky sweet. overall was nice to try it out. It might not be my first option when thinking of places to go around there, but a possible option.

GcyVmarb8kncO_IatVWYJw.text: Nice little shop - perfect for a lazy Saturday brunch..we came in a little late and got the entire place to ourselves. The egg and emmental cheese crepe was delicious. The bruschetta tasted very different but was great..the ambience is very cozy and intimate and definitely recommend this place..

photos.caption: Photo of Entre Nous Creperie - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Entre Nous Creperie - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Entre Nous Creperie - Singapore, Singapore

4qg5OXu3SZZ1iVR0AWD9HA.text: This small tiny shop can be easily missed. My husband and I walked around the area a couple of times to find this place. Google maps was not that helpful and directed us somewhere else. We got to the shop a bit late, but was able to order the Crepe with Salted Butter Caramel Ice Cream. It was my first time getting crepe and the fillings separately. The crepe was flat on the plate with a small dish of ice cream next to it. I was in for a bit of shock when I first saw it, but I realized that if you have the fillings separated from the crepe the crepe would taste much better and it would not become soggy. So we would cut pieces of the crepe out one at a time and place a small portion of the ice cream right on top and pick the crepe up and enjoy. The taste was amazing, where the crepe is still a bit warm and the ice cream is still cold. The crepe was also slightly sweetened but I did also tasted a tiny bit of saltiness (it could have been from the ice cream as well). The blend of both ice cream and crepe was wonderful. I would love to stop by this small shop, if we have the time.

photos.caption: Photo of Entre Nous Creperie - Singapore, Singapore. Salted Butter Caramel Ice Cream Crepe

h80Ch_YGTkgrW6DD_StqRQ.text: The first crepe I've had since our trip to France 1.5 years ago, and I am happy that the crepes tasted great here!It is a tiny restaurant and crepes are nothing fancy, this place is ran by French people and the decoration is very much like a typical French bistro.They serve both sweet and savory crepes. We only tried the savory ones and they were great. Nothing fancy just the typical ingredients but the crepe is thin and tasty and that made me happy.The only minus is the fonts on the menu is soooo hard to read!! Maybe it's my old eyes...

photos.caption: Photo of Entre Nous Creperie - Singapore, Singapore. Ham and emmental cheese savory crepe

70k_lXX5fukwvWCEREimGw.text: The best crepes in Singapore, certified by my french partner. Super authentic (forget soggy crepes from Paul!!), plentiful of selections, and delicious of course.Our favorites are crepe complete and Stephane's favorite for the savory one.. and sugar or caramel or Nutella for the sweet one.Do not forget the cider. I love the dry but my partner prefers the sweet one.Though it may appear to be at the pricey side by both Singapore or Paris standard (for a creperie!), their crepes at Entre-nous indeed are worthwhile!!We are regulars and will continue to be.

photos.caption: Photo of Entre Nous Creperie - Singapore, Singapore. Super delicious nutella crepe...

CntKIKLDjtfJ9wiVBZ9rfQ.text: The restaurant takes cash only.  Be aware.There were several tables on a Saturday night and it was clearly a place for groups (although we went as our date night).  Many complain about value for money and the portions being small.  For a crepe the portion is NOT small.  But normally we mentally associate crepe not as entree food and hence this value for money question in mind.  We ordered the classic savoury and sweet ones and were very happy with the quality.The service is attentive and we would definitely go back.

SZxMpWzfo2tAk-JmODOn2Q.text: True authentic Brittany crepes! We have tried crepe in many places outside Brittany... This still tops our list

QVR6hFMfrz-hFB8Hq4mXvQ.text: Gluten free buckwheat crepes!? Yes, please! Especially if they come with apples and salted caramel :-)Simple, french with nautical styling, Entre-nous is a little haven of France serving gluten free delights in the centre of Singapore. Crepes are reasonably priced - from 9-15 dollars with lots of choices of delicious fillings. The husband and wife team who run this gem are lovely.This is my second visit to Singapore but when I'm in town, I always try to visit :-)

xtZNg2Kw2vq8gN5qfRnrsA.text: The number one thing you need to know: they make their own caramel. Which you can buy in a jar to slather on all sorts of things. OMNOMNOMAn ideal meal for me would be: goat's cheese on toast, drizzled with honey (so simple, so good), a savoury crepe (buckwheat, so it must be good for me), and anything with that fantastic caramel. All washed down with cider. The restaurant doesn't have much in terms of ambiance, but the food is good (French chef, French girlfriend), and that's really all that we want.

photos.caption: Photo of Entre Nous Creperie - Singapore, Singapore. Omelette blanket on a crepe
Photo of Entre Nous Creperie - Singapore, Singapore. My beloved goat's cheese and honey
Photo of Entre Nous Creperie - Singapore, Singapore. Cider in teacups!

nNFvb5AR6fOtzf_NpfhIwg.text: Buckwheat crepes?House made salted caramel?So much cred for a creperie, and rightfully so - the flavours are impeccable, and that caramel? I'd buy bottles to give everyone I know.Come visit them, and help keep them in business for a long, long time. You'll feel the same after you've made that life-changing Entre-Nous crepe.

uDG4UC-4uwHMrFw8n7W6Zg.text: The good: Solid 2 stars, and thankfully the shining light here is the food.  Thick menu selections for both savory and sweet crepes. I have to admit, I was pleasantly surprised at how good the crepes tasted (and buckwheat no less).  Came on a Sunday and despite it being close to a full house, the 1 server and 1 cook managed shockingly well. When I am craving crepes this will be where I will look to first. The bad:  Decor needs a huge overhaul. Tables, chairs, art, it all needs to be revamped. The "booth" seating is just a run of small padding on a 90 degree plastic bench. Incredibly uncomfortable to sit on. The walls were sparse which not only looks bad but it bounces sounds and makes for an amplified chamber of chatter. I could easily, and unwillingly, hear every conversation from every table. On that day there was a couple breaking up, an infant smacking a spoon repeatedly on the table, a family on vacation and a handful of locals talking about Thailand. See, that was annoying just to read, imagine listening to that for a whole meal. The ugly: Doesn't pull off the quaint mom and pop vibe although the staff makes me suspect they are. If so, make it more homey, if not, pour some money into making it higher end. Prices are too high, but I didn't mind so much considering the food was good.  But at the end of the day should anyone pay $20+ for a crepe?

wSKSn3gVrXL4Wkv85sS2Dw.text: Délicieux! So happy to have found this restaurant and they have a wide selection of gluten free menu items... including gluten free crepes and french onion soup! The owner has been there every time I have come in to eat and she is very sweet. Love this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Entre Nous Creperie - Singapore, Singapore. Salted caramel crepe (not gluten free)
Photo of Entre Nous Creperie - Singapore, Singapore. Gluten free savory crepe with goat cheese and honey
Photo of Entre Nous Creperie - Singapore, Singapore. Restaurant view from the street

dhJwTAHEUPQTxkymSTcpAQ.text: After coming back from France, I had one of those horrible holiday withdrawal symptoms of wanting to gorge on all the food that I had while I was away. Entre Nous was the pick after scouring the web to find a good creperie and it was a fantastic holiday hangover cure.The great thing is that they have a wide selection of savoury and dessert crepes so you can practically have a crepes feast! Had a crepe accompanied with roasted chicken and caramelized onion, topped with tangy mustard. It was actually surprisingly filling. You will be spoilt for choice though, I couldn't make up my mind for over 10 minutes. For dessert, you have to try the sweet crepe drizzled with their homemade salted butter caramel - heaven in every bite.

yEtajr-0o4OBh-9Bxhbh9g.text: The crepes were indeed quite flavourful even without the fillings, such would often give me a sign that I'm in for a real treat.a moist buchetta with a main chicken and caramelised onion crepes was strangely filling and quite a joy to have especially for one who loves getting his taste buds teased at every bite. :)I'd look forward to sitting outside for a meal the next time as sound bounces off the walls due to it's layout. Seems like a common issue for most restaurants in Singapore

aHDJO8v0WfTRSE2NblNpDw.text: A small and simple French cafe, Entre-nous is best described as not very fancy but perfectly adequate. Just like the cafe itself, my favourite of course is the no-frills crepe with caramel. Anyone who can make such a simple dessert taste amazing has earned my respect. The best part has to be the caramel with just the right texture and richness of taste that jazzes up the otherwise plain crepe.The savoury crepes are also worth a try and very very French indeed. The authenticity of the cuisine is not a question at all, and although it might be a little expensive for a dish that is not very filling, I've never regretted having a crepe there yet.

u1oGhBJQqK7mbuv4Qia_eQ.text: Whatever you're doing, stop and head over to this place right now. I cannot say enough good things about the food. I had found out about Entre Nous while searching for gluten free options on a recent trip to Singapore. My main regret is that we waited until our last night in town to try this place out! My boyfriend and I both had savory buckwheat crepes that were amazing! I had the egg, ham, cheese crepe and even though not marked GF on the menu, it actually is. We also split the crime brûlée which has an unbelievably delicious salted carmel sauce. We were so impressed with the meal and the atmosphere of the restaurant (and depressed that we were leaving the next day and unable to come back to try more) that we left, walked around for an hour and came back to try a sweet crepe as well! Although the normal sweet crepe isn't gluten free, they can make them on the gf buckwheat crepes. Just as delicious.  I can't wait to come back to Singapore and hit up this spot again!

FLYbv_a87Eu2TyqZXQGbGw.text: Best restaurant in Singapore, and gluten free friendly! I had dinner and dessert, then went back for a second dessert around an hour later. Try the "La Pointe du Raz", a crepe with chocolate sauce, pear, and the most delicious ginger ice cream. We had it on buckwheat, which added a nice depth of flavor. Definitely order anything with the homemade salted caramel sauce, or just ask for a container to take home. I'm already planning a return trip to Singapore for more.

43il3-I9llLfVXEazgnDIg.text: small restaurant with not many tables, but serves authentic crepes made by french people. the spinach in the savoury crepe tastes way better than you might think. also, the salted butter caramel crepe was delicious.
